sentences.sContent: At Christmas the stores stay open late.
sentences.sCn: 在圣诞节期间，商店营业到很晚。

sentences.sContent: ...I open the store when I want and leave when I want...
...the sign on my store says the hours are ten to six...
...One could remove junk food to the back of the store and ban them from the shelves at checkout lines...
...You don't have to hit the grocery store daily...
...send a letter to the store that sold it...
...She walked to the local grocery store to buy broken biscuits which were much cheaper...
...One reason the author's father could sit and eat at the drug store was that he didn't look that dark...
...One could remove junk food to the back of the store and ban them from the shelves at checkout lines...
...What happened in a drug store that greatly annoyed the speaker...
...But the store manger laid the evil eye on us...

synos.tran: 商店；[贸易][金融]储备，贮藏；[建][经]仓库

phrases.pCn: 贮藏着；准备着；将要发生
储藏备用；准备着，储藏着

words.tran: 店主；仓库管理员；零售店店主

trans.tranOther: a place where goods are sold to the public. In British English, a store is large and sells many different things, but in American English, a store can be large or small, and sell many things or only one type of thing.
